pages.text: Whether it's Beds, Chests, or Coffins- we all need something to drop our gear in and call home.

pages.title: Crate
pages.text: Decent for storage.

pages.title: Barrel
pages.text: Good for storage or making planters.

pages.title: Chest
pages.text: Two can be combined into a double-wide storage container.

pages.title: Deepslate Chest
pages.text: Heavy, and a slight eye-sore, but holds more than a regular Chest.

pages.title: Plank Stool
pages.text: Kick back and rest your feet a while.

pages.title: Plank Chair
pages.text: Comes with free back support.

pages.title: Plank Table
pages.text: Not the best looking table, but it does the job.

pages.title: Counter
pages.text: The table's awkward relative.

pages.title: Counter Corner
pages.text: Counters, but curved.

pages.title: Counter Drawer
pages.text: Provides a small amount of storage.

pages.title: Cabinet
pages.text: Not much storage space, but good for taking advantage of unused wall/ceiling space.

pages.title: Coffin
pages.text: For a final resting place.

pages.title: Grave Marker
pages.text: For honoring the dead.

pages.title: Gravestone
pages.text: For honoring the dead. Can be detailed with a Stonecutter.

pages.title: Empty Shelf
pages.text: Good for storing Books, Scrolls, Potions- most anything, really.

pages.title: Cushions
pages.text: They make for good pet beds, seats, or extending beds!

pages.title: Clay Bowl
pages.text: Good for cooking or keeping pets hydrated.

pages.title: Fireguard
pages.text: Keep your pets safe!

pages.title: Brazier
pages.text: Reminds me of the Iron Braziers I found in the Dungeons made by the Ancient Ones.

pages.title: Canvas Curtain
pages.text: Because you probably don't want to see the monsters outside at night.

pages.title: Keg
pages.text: Stay hyrdrated, me hearties, yo ho!

pages.title: Copper Wastebin
pages.text: Blight-Sludge. Pretty, but destructive.

pages.title: Lattices
pages.text: Useful as fences, walls, or even windows.

pages.title: Stacked Logs
pages.text: Good for holding up roofs, acting as ceiling lattices, or impromptu stairs.

pages.title: Thatch
pages.text: Makes for cheap but effective roofing and soft floors.

pages.title: Wall Candelabra
pages.text: A nice way to display a candle on a wall.

pages.title: Small Candelabra
pages.text: A nice way to display a candle.

pages.title: Medium Candelabra
pages.text: A fancy way to display a candle, slightly brighter than a Small Candelabra, too.

pages.title: Large Candelabra
pages.text: An elegant way to display several candles and light up a room.

pages.title: Target
pages.text: Great for practicing Archery. Produces a redstone signal when hit, too.

pages.title: Lectern
pages.text: Made for displaying books, journals, notes, et cet.

pages.title: Item Frame
pages.text: Made for displaying items or maps.

pages.title: Jukebox
pages.text: No one knows how to make Music Discs anymore- but making a device to play the ones you find is simple enough.
